content.description: Pockets and edges down low to the roof where you can get a good rest if needed then up the headwall above on a series of opposing layaway moves. Rated a little harder in the guidebook but it seems no harder than the route just to the left.
content.location:
Between

Industrial Bliss

and

Manufacturer's Defect

in the middle of the wall.

content.description:
Climb a dirty slab up to the base of the roof, reach up and out to a good pocket in the roof and then power over with no feet until able to get established over the lip. Finish up blocky ledges to reach the anchors.

Bees are active on the lower portion of this climb when it's warm out so be warned!
Good climbing that starts of at Mass Production and begins as a link up that traverse left to Made to Order, where the crux of the climb is at.
content.location: Same start as Mass Production (4th climb from the left), but after the 4th bolt, traverse left and finish of at the anchors of Made to Order

content.description:
Climb up a short face to reach a flake which is turned on the left then continue up the face above on good holds.

Bees are active on the lower portion of this climb when it's warm out so bee warned!
content.protection: 7 bolts,  2 bolt anchor with very long chains
content.location: This is the obvious left-facing corner on the right side of the wall.

content.description: Climbs the steep face using a combination of pockets, sidepulls and edges with a few sucker holds thrown in for good measure. Fairly continuous with a pump crux going from the last bolt to the anchors.
Shares the same start / first bolt as "Assembly Line" and moves straight up on positive holds to a double ring anchor.
content.location: Located a few feet left of "Nuts and Bolts 5.10c"

content.description:
This route climbs up the area where the brown rock begins to transition to gray rock. A little chossy.

Beginning leaders might be better off climbing the 5.10a route Made To Order to the right of this one.
content.protection: 6 bolts to double ring anchors. Shares anchors with Fun Factory.
content.location: Second route from the left, between Fun Factory (5.7) and Made To Order (5.10a).

content.description:
Climbs straight up on positive holds in a variety of directions. Pockets, sidepulls, edges

The 4th bolt is somewhat hidden from view if you're looking up from the bottom.
content.location: Starts just a few feet right of Quality Control 5.10c

content.description: Straight up to the crux between the top bolt and anchors. Simple route with great holds all the way.
content.location: 4th route to the right of fun factory (5.7)

content.description:
Thin edges at the start quickly give way to pockets, edges and even a few underclings as you twist and turn your way to the break at the roof. Catch your breath and then head up the pumpy headwall making use of the occasional pocket to recover if needed.

A little scrappy but it's cleaning up and will only get better.
content.location:
Between

Worker Bee

and

Assembly Line

in the center of the wall.

content.description: Definitely a "made-to-order" route: lots of glue identifying the manufactured holds. Mostly juggy and vertical until between the last bolt and the anchors, when the climb turns slabby.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a double ring anchor.
content.location: Third route from the left. Starts on the long, low rock.

content.description: A manufactured climb that route developer created into a very high quality climb that I consider the best 5.10 at the crag. Climb goes straight up, passing the very left side of a small roof to all positive holds.  Steepens up at top right before the anchors.
content.location: 10 feet right of Mass Production, 5th route to the right and starts on top of a small rock. Rappel or lower down

content.description:
Climbs up on natural and manufactured holds up the right facing ramp/crack system. Lots of different fun movements make this climb the best at the quarry for the grade. The crux lies a little bit after the 5th bolt where it joins up with the climb to the right. To clean it top rope the other end up and un-clip as you go.

Anchors are shared with the 5.9 to the right so you can setup a toprope for that climb via this route.
content.protection: 7 bolts to a two bolt anchor with rappel rings.
content.location: Starts on the slab section in the rust colored area to the far left of the main wall. Follows the obvious line up to the anchors.

content.description: Starts sharing the same first bolt as Quality Control then make moves out left on solid jugs to a left facing flake system.
content.location: Starts a few feet left of "Nuts and Bolts 5.10c"
